CatDescriptText: Henry C. Battles, janitor, 2545 Chauncey Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 8, 1959, pg. B1 with question: "Do you believe the John James Racket Squad is driving the numbers racket out of Pittsburgh?" answer reads: "They are driving them into hiding, but I can't say whether or not they are driving the 'numbers' racket out of Pittsburgh."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of man wearing hat with striped band and eyeglasses, and Henry C. Battles wearing striped light colored short sleeved shirt with second button unfastened and pen in breast pocket, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs and Kappels in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
